taskbody.context: Use this procedure to create and configure the thin pool for application data storage. This procedure does not include specific values for the size of the thin pool. For more information about sizing this resource, refer to the documentation for your application. Or, use the suggested minimum value, 200GB. You can add storage to an LVM thin pool at any time.

step.cmd: Log in to the master host .
Identify the block device or partition for the thin pool to create, and the amount of space available on it.
step.info: The thin pool stores both application data and snapshots of the data. To start, plan on using 50% of the total space for application data and 50% for snapshots of the data.

stepxmp.p: Replace Path-To-Device with the path of the target device or partition, and replace 50-Percent with 50% of the space available on the target device or partition. Include a symbol for the units (gigabytes, G) after the number:

step.stepresult: On success, the result includes the name of the thin pool, which always starts with /dev/mapper.

step.cmd: Edit and add storage variables in the configuration file, /etc/default/serviced.
step.info: The following variables are used to configure application data thin pools:

substep.cmd: Add SERVICED_DM_THINPOOLDEV immediately after SERVICED_FS_TYPE, and set its value.

stepxmp.p: Replace Thin-Pool-Name with the name of the thin pool specified in the preceding serviced-storage command:

substep.cmd: Add SERVICED_DM_BASESIZE immediately after SERVICED_DM_THINPOOLDEV, and set its value.

stepxmp.p: Replace 50-Percent with the number specified with the dm.basesize argument in the preceding serviced-storage command. Do not include a symbol for the units; just the number:
